intro: Onosma leucocarpa, commonly known as white-fruited onosma, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, blue or purple flowers that bloom in summer, followed by spherical, white fruits that are distinctive and showy. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
